Hey,

Just added your logs in, as some may be wary about clicking random downloads on the internet.

If you have any questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:

* The [**NA Boards Discord**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification)
* The [**Discuss the Boards**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board

You spent the majority of these two games arguing with your teammates, insulted them, and asked for reports. If you received a permanent suspension for these games, it's because you ignored the multiple punishments you had beforehand that told you this type of behavior was against the rules. 

 When you go through a 10-game chat restriction, a 25-game chat restriction, and a 14-day gameplay suspension with a reform card that explicitly states "Any continued negativity will result in a permanent suspension."?

 Yes, this type of behavior will warrant a ban.

OK what exactly did I say that warranted perma ban I’ve never had chat restriction and had a 14 day maybe 3-4 months ago for stuff way worse than this. It makes no sense when I have an inter and i flame him LIGHTLY that I never get to play the game again??

> [{quoted}](name=Allegretto45,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3Ey8Zghh,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2020-01-28T03:47:52.409+0000)
>
> OK what exactly did I say that warranted perma ban I’ve never had chat restriction and had a 14 day maybe 3-4 months ago for stuff way worse than this. It makes no sense when I have an inter and i flame him LIGHTLY that I never get to play the game again??

 You asked for reports, called your teammates bad, told people to int your teammates and keep them in a "piss low elo", and spammed "gg ff" as well as "open mid" while encouraging the enemy team to end the game.

 The only way you could receive an immediate 14-day suspension without going through any chat restrictions is by using zero-tolerance language (such as racism or homophobia) or by being a smurf account since they can sometimes receive more severe punishments. If your 14-day suspension was 3-4 months ago, that means your behavior hasn't improved enough to warrant the punishment tiers dropping. 

 A 14-day suspension is also the final straw for an account, meaning it would take less to get a permanent suspension at that point.

Calling for reports is harassment, "go next" and "open mid" are giving up, "mid gap" is harassment, you spend most of your time in chat arguing. Riot realized that lighter punishments were having no effect, so they put a stop to your behavior in the only avenue available to them: a permaban.

But the fact that stating you've given up when a game is completely lost can get you banned there's something seriously wrong. OP had a 14-day suspension a few months ago. After such a punishment, the next offense - whatever it may be, from racial slurs to passive-aggressive nagging - is a permaban. Saying "mid gap" is harassment against your mid laner, because it means that they're worse than their opponent. OP also talked about adding a teammate to an "int list," meaning to watch for that player and intentionally feed in their games. Yes, stating that you've given up is considered "giving up" (duh) which has a long history of being [unacceptable behavior](http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-n5l_I7-xGVc/ViAj7B0oChI/AAAAAAAAy3E/TqkUwifYPNI/s1600/78678.jpg). "Stating which lane lost" accomplishes nothing other than making that laner feel bad.
